# CONVICTION ACTS AS RALLYING CRY FOR REPUBLICANS

TAPPING INTO OUTRAGE

Trump Campaign Says It Raised Millions After His Guilty Verdict

By SHANE GOLDMACHER and LUKE BROMAWAITER

A day after Donald J. Trump’s conviction in quickly became clear that Republicans across the country could not run away from his newfound status as a knob.

They would, instead, run on it.

Electing Mr. Trump in casting a vote for New York came as a disgraceful display. Republicans candidated for party committees used the first criminal conviction of a former president as a rallying cry — for campaign cash, for congressional support and for momentum to win a November election.
